cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the northern Leeward Islands, then bending slightly northwest toward the southeastern Bahamas and ultimately toward south Florida/the Florida Keys
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or extreme south Florida (near PortMiami)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Florida coast including Miami-Dade and Broward counties, Florida Keys, northward along the peninsula
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (64%) of tropical-storm-force winds, with up to a 35% chance of sustained 50-kt (hurricane-force gusts possible) beginning late Saturday night through Sunday at PortMiami.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of several feet possible along Biscayne Bay and the Miami waterfront as the core approaches/lands Sunday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 6â€“10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, producing urban flooding around PortMiami.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents, possible channel siltation and debris affecting vessel traffic.
